GMHO:0000047.label: adverse event following an intervention
GMHO:0000047.definition: A pathological bodily process that occurs after the intervention delivery starts.
variables: Number of participants with measurement for adverse events following intervention
Number of participants with adverse events following intervention

GMHO:0000214.definition: Number of intervention participants for whom an outcome has been identified within a study.

Number of participants with akathisia following intervention

BCIO:015416.label: mean human age population statistic
BCIO:015416.definition: The mean of human age in a population.

GMHO:0000233.label: agitation following intervention
GMHO:0000233.definition: An adverse event following an intervention that involves experiencing agitation.
variables: Number of participants with agitation following intervention
Number of participants with measurement for agitation following intervention

GMHO:0000051.label: akathisia following pharmacological intervention
GMHO:0000051.definition: A drug-induced movement disorder following intervention that involves feeling restlessness, increased urges to move and reduced capability to suppress such urges.
variables: Number of participants with akathisia following intervention
Number of participants with measurement for akathisia following intervention

GMHO:0000201.label: anhedonia scale
GMHO:0000201.definition: A measurement scale that is used to measure anhedonia symptom severity.

GMHO:0000212.label: measurement scale at baseline
GMHO:0000212.definition: A measurement scale used to measure baseline data in a study.

GMHO:0000208.label: scale directionality
GMHO:0000208.definition: An information content entity about the orientation of a measurement's scoring system in which higher numerical levels can indicate higher or lower levels of a construct.

GMHO:0000131.label: anhedonia symptom severity
GMHO:0000131.definition: Symptom severity that is associated with anhedonia.
variables: Number of participants for whom baseline anhedonia was measured
Number of participants for whom followup anhedonia was measured

OBI:0000679.label: average value
OBI:0000679.definition: A data item that is produced as the output of an averaging data transformation and represents the average value of the input data.

GMHO:0000209.label: measurement datum at baseline
GMHO:0000209.definition: Measurement datum that was recorded as baseline data in a study.
variables: Number of participants for whom baseline anxiety was measured
Number of participants for whom baseline anhedonia was measured

OBCS:0000077.label: standard deviation
OBCS:0000077.definition: A quantitative confidence value that measures the variability of data around the mean.

GMHO:0000205.label: measurement scale at followup
GMHO:0000205.definition: A measurement scale used to measure followup data in a study.

GMHO:0000203.label: information on available followup data
GMHO:0000203.definition: An information content entity about the followup data available for a study.

GMHO:0000221.label: anticholinergic symptom following intervention
GMHO:0000221.definition: An adverse event following an intervention that involves symptoms associated with anticholinergic drugs.
variables: Number of participants with measurements for anticholinergic symptom following intervention
Number of participants with anticholinergic symptom following intervention

GMHO:0000202.label: anxiety scale
GMHO:0000202.definition: A measurement scale that is used to measure anxiety symptom severity.

GMHO:0000143.label: anxiety symptom severity
GMHO:0000143.definition: Symptom severity that is associated with an anxiety symptom.
variables: Number of participants for whom baseline anxiety was measured
Number of participants for whom followup anxiety was measured

GMHO:0000238.label: anxiousness following intervention
GMHO:0000238.definition: An adverse event following an intervention that involves feeling anxiety.
variables: Number of participants with anxiety following intervention
Number of participants with measurement for anxiety following intervention
